intro: Ligusticum mutellina var. adonidifolium, commonly known as the Adonis-leaved Ligusticum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of the Adonis genus, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. This variant is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
